evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The APA directs courts to hold unlawful and set aside agency actions that are not in accordance with law. 5 U.S.C. § 706(2)(A).

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: In 2002, Congress enacted, and the President signed, the Education Sciences Reform Act of 2002, Pub. L. 107-279.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Defendants have deferred a budget authority in a manner contrary to the Impoundment Control Act, in violation of the APA.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The Anti-Deficiency Act provides, in relevant part, that “in apportioning or reapportioning an appropriation, a reserve may be established only—(A) to provide for contingencies; (B) to achieve savings made possible by or through changes in requirements or greater efficiency of operations; or (C) as specifically provided by law.”

evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: conducting and disseminating research and evaluation related to implementation of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA), 20 U.S.C. § 1464, and to the condition of career and technical education (CTE) and effectiveness of federally funded CTE programs under the Perkins Act, 29 U.S.C. § 2324.
